title: Network & Services Operation Analyst
tagsAndSkills: project management,customer service,business analysis,problem management,dispute management,switching,networking,bgp
jobDescription:
Skill required: Network Billing Operations - Problem Management

Designation: Network & Svcs Operation Analyst

Qualifications:Any Graduation

Years of Experience:3 to 5 years


What would you do?
Dispute Management Bill Cycle Process:?Billing Dispute Management Services covers dispute management customer center, M&P, dispute call center & back office functions, Project management services, etc.Job Responsibilities:1.Responsible for Bill Cycle checks by performing pre-bill run validations, Performa sample post bill run validations, generation and printing of Alt Media, ebill, etc. and loading of PDF invoices to the customer portal (Applicable to UB, GBP, DCS, Oracle, IES, and IBS-CLA & Canada bill cycles).2.Tools Development - Tooling/Requirements/ Work center balancing 3.Analytics - Tech/Reporting4.Complex Billing Project Management - Escalation from front line to resolve complex billing issues5.Analyze and determine resolution actions of recurring billing issues 6.Perform pre-bill validations and share anomalies with billing operations team7.Perform internal and external audits at periodic intervals & ensure adequate controls are in place for the observations identified.8.Analyze data as inputs to leadership presentations9.Determine and trigger required actions/coordinate with dispute agents for resolutions10.Perform bill verification and review as required11.Perform inquiries, receive calls from customers, sales account managers in regards to disputes, and electronic disputes for categories including US billing (i.e. UB New Products, MOW, and Legacy MOW, complex billing management, sapphire and dispute management) 12.Perform Fraud investigation activities as requiredSKILL SETS REQUIRED:-
  • Analytical ability to organize, evaluate, and present complex data with excellent written and oral skills
  • Knowledge of telecommunications services
  • Stakeholder management skills
  • Effective communication skills
  • Knowledge in Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio Excel, Access, Project
  • SQL, Visual Studio experience
  • Ability to handle the critical situations and manage complexity
  • Customer service skills
  • PC literacy (Ability to work with data, transform and display data into reasonable and understandable format)
  • Time management skills ability to track work independently and in timely manner
  • Negotiation skills to ensure customer satisfaction as well as satisfaction of AT&T internal processes and rulesWhat are we looking for?
  • Ability to communicate on different organizational levels, with different organizational audiences from different parts of the world.
  • Broader Project Management knowledge and/or Business Analysis Experience is big advantage
  • Demonstrates abilities to investigate and resolve billing inquires and billing disputes raised by internal/external customer
  • Ability to pay attention to detail, to make conscious effort to understand causes and to address all identified billing issues
  • Problem solver with very good analytical skills, able to spot issues that need to be deeply investigated - Roles and Responsibilities:
  • In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems
  • Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors
  • In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management
  • You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments
  • The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others
  • You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work
  • Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shiftsQualificationsAny Graduation

title: Engagement Lead
tagsAndSkills: BPO,Analytical,Social media,Employee engagement,Engagement Lead,Wellness,Outsourcing,Management
jobDescription:
The Site Employee Engagement Lead will develop and manage employee programs, events, and strategies that align with the organization s core values, focusing on enhancing workplace culture and employee engagement. This role is dedicated to improving employee satisfaction, retention, and productivity by fostering a supportive and inclusive work environment.
 
Aim :
To ensure that everyone is aligned with TaskUs engagement process.
Purpose
The purpose of this document is to outline and explain TaskUs Engagement process and guidelines. It aims to help you identify opportunities for engagement and ensure the inclusive and adequate representation of TaskUs values and culture.
Skills
  • Leadership: Ability to lead initiatives and inspire others to engage fully in their work.
  • Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
  • Emotional Intelligence: High level of empathy and understanding of employee needs and concerns.
  • Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to address employee issues effectively.
  • Creativity: Innovative approach to developing engagement activities and programs.
  • Collaboration: Strong team player with the ability to work effectively across all levels of the organization.
Key Responsibilities:
Employee Engagement Strategy:
  • Develop and implement site-specific employee engagement initiatives aligned with the overall company strategy.
  • Create weekly/monthly site-level engagement calendar
  • Conduct regular surveys and feedback sessions to assess employee satisfaction and identify areas for improvement.
  • Planning & execution of site-level activities
  • Mindful planning & managing engagement budget to execute the activities
  • Calibrate with the engagement committee about the concepts of events, and secure approvals from the site VP.
  • Interact and collaborate effectively and positively with individuals of all levels of the organization.
  • Analyze data to inform engagement strategies and measure the effectiveness of initiatives.
Communication and Culture:
  • Promote open and transparent communication within the site.
  • Organize and facilitate events, workshops, and activities that foster a positive work culture and community.
  • Serve as a cultural ambassador, promoting company values and ensuring they are integrated into daily operations.
  • Site-wise communications, promotional materials, upcoming events and activities
  • Managing Site specific Social Media posts (if required)
Recognition and Reward Programs:
  • Develop and manage employee recognition and reward programs (Kudos Carnival) to acknowledge and celebrate achievements.
  • Create and distribute regular communications highlighting employee accomplishments and milestones.
Community and Team Building:
  • Plan and execute team-building activities that strengthen relationships and improve collaboration
  • Foster a sense of community by organizing social events and volunteer opportunities.
  • Participate in professional growth activities

1. Achieve sales volume and after sale service - Achieving sales volume & targets (Weekly / Monthly / Quarterly / Annually). - Attending after sales service queries.

2.
